intro: Sphaeranthus rogersii, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small stars. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in hot, dry environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in summer, and the plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Sphaeranthus rogersii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
